results.abstract: article on space shuttle project; shuttle development traced from inception in '70; NASA officials put price for design, development and testing of 1st 2 vehicles at $5.2-billion ('71 dollars); shuttle equipment, parts and crew functions discussed; NASA says there will be about 560 separate shuttle missions between '80 and '91; notes NASA will use about 1/2 of flights, Defense Dept 100, commercial customers 60, foreign orgns 65 and other US GOvt agencies 28; maintain shuttle will be cost effective with half of projected traffic; illus (L)

headline.main: Behind the Best Sellers: Robert J. Ringer

results.snippet: With titles like "Winning Through Intimidation" and "Looking Out for #1" to his credit, Robert J. Ringer promises to be a real stinker. True, the book jacket photo shows a fairly likeable-looking sportive youngster, but then Nero was probably a...
results.lead_paragraph: With titles like "Winning Through Intimidation" and "Looking Out for #1" to his credit, Robert J. Ringer promises to be a real stinker. True, the book jacket photo shows a fairly likeable-looking sportive youngster, but then Nero was probably a lovely baby, too.

results.abstract: US space shuttle Enterprise is scheduled to make its 1st solo flight on Aug 12 when astronauts Fred W Haise Jr and Lt Col C Gordon Fullerton take controls and test spaceplane's ability to glide without power back to earth; test is critical to plans of NASA to develop 1st reusable vehicle for making space travel more econ; Donald K Slayton, landing test mgr, comments at conf at Flight Research Center; 3 TV networks and their local stations have scheduled live coverage (M)

byline.original: By JOHN NOBLE WILFORD Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: EDWARDS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Aug. 11--The nation's space shuttle is scheduled to make its first solo flight here tomorrow when two astronauts take the controls and test the spaceplane's ability to glide without power back to earth after a future journey into space.

byline.original: By JOHN NOBLE WILFORD Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: EDWARDS AIR FORCE BASE, Calif., Aug. 12 The space shuttle Enterprise, the first of a fleet of re-usable vehicles for making space travel a more workaday experience, passed its first flight test today by making a smooth glide landing on a dry lake bed in the Mojave Desert.

results.abstract: space shuttle Enterprise passes 1st solo flight test by making smooth glide landing in Mojave Desert; Haise and Fullerton say aircraft is stable and as easy to handle in powerless flight as predicted by design engineers, news conf; estimated 60,000 people watched piggyback takeoff from 747 airplane; illus (M)

headline.main: Bohemian Grove Where Big Shots Go to Camp

results.snippet: MONTE RIO, Calif. When Gerald R. Ford, Henry A. Kissinger and A.W. Clausen joined 2,000 of the richest and most powerful men in the country at the annual ritual known as the "Summer Encampment" at Bohemian Grove near this sleepy hamlet of 997 last...
results.lead_paragraph: MONTE RIO, Calif. When Gerald R. Ford, Henry A. Kissinger and A.W. Clausen joined 2,000 of the richest and most powerful men in the country at the annual ritual known as the "Summer Encampment" at Bohemian Grove near this sleepy hamlet of 997 last months, did they make decisions that will shape America's destiny, or was it merely "the greatest men's party on earth?"

results.abstract: J Reston says that as foreign policy has become more complicated, tendency has been to recruit experienced professionals like Lloyd N Culter, Washington lawyer who has been apptd by Carter to negotiate 200-mi off-shore zone agreement with Canada, to concentrate on special problems; says a lot of hard work is being done by men and women who are seldom mentioned in news
results.snippet: OTIS AIR FORCE BASE, Aug. 25 Diplomacy, which appears in Stevenson's Book of Quotations between "Dining" and "Disappointment," is changing fast these days. Increasingly it deals, not with manners or abstractions, but with serious economic disputes...
results.lead_paragraph: OTIS AIR FORCE BASE, Aug. 25 Diplomacy, which appears in Stevenson's Book of Quotations between "Dining" and "Disappointment," is changing fast these days. Increasingly it deals, not with manners or abstractions, but with serious economic disputes between nations over, among other things the future control of the resources of the oceans.

results.abstract: Johnson Space Center has recd more than 8,000 applications from women interested in becoming astronauts since initiating recruitment drive late in '76 (S)

headline.main: Follow-Up on the News; Inquiry on Lefkowitz

headline.main: SOMALI GOES TO MOSCOW AT SOVIET INVITATION

results.snippet: NAIROBI, Kenya, Aug. 29 (AP) President Mohammed Siad Barre of Somalia has flown to the Soviet Union, the major supplier of arms to both the Somalians and their Ethiopian rivals, at the invitation of the Soviet Government, the Mogadishu radio reported...
results.lead_paragraph: NAIROBI, Kenya, Aug. 29 (AP) President Mohammed Siad Barre of Somalia has flown to the Soviet Union, the major supplier of arms to both the Somalians and their Ethiopian rivals, at the invitation of the Soviet Government, the Mogadishu radio reported today.
